title: MongoDB
text_left:
MongoDB is a popular NoSQL database known for its flexibility and scalability. It stores data in flexible, JSON-like documents, meaning fields can vary from document to document and data structure can be changed over time. MongoDB is designed for high availability and scalability with automatic sharding and replication features. It's well-suited for applications requiring fast access to large volumes of data, complex queries, and agile development processes. MongoDB is widely used for big data applications, content management, mobile and social infrastructure, and more.


MongoDB

Fireship

Net Ninja

title: DynamoDB
text_left:
DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). It offers fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability. DynamoDB allows users to store and retrieve any amount of data and serves any level of request traffic. It automatically distributes data and traffic over servers to handle high throughput and provides built-in security, backup and restore, and in-memory caching. DynamoDB is ideal for web, mobile, gaming, ad tech, IoT, and many other applications that require low-latency data access at any scale.


DynamoDB

title: MySQL
text_left:
MySQL is a widely used open-source relational database management system (RDBMS). It is known for its reliability, efficiency, and ease of use. MySQL uses structured query language (SQL) to manage and manipulate data stored in tables and supports a wide range of data types. It is a popular choice for web applications and acts as the database component of the LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP/Python/Perl) stack. MySQL offers features like transaction support, subqueries, triggers, views, and stored procedures. It is suitable for a wide variety of applications, from small to large-scale enterprise projects, providing robust data management and integration capabilities.



MySQL
